steps.title: Welcome to Promptfoo!
steps.description:
Learn how to evaluate AI models for language learning applications.

**What you'll learn:**
- Test language grading accuracy
- Evaluate feedback quality
- Compare GPT-4 vs Gemini performance
- Optimize for educational outcomes

[Open Tutorial Workspace](command:vscode.openFolder?%5B%22tutorial-workspace%22%5D)

steps.title: Install Promptfoo CLI
steps.description:
First, let's install the Promptfoo command-line tool.

**Click below to run the install command:**

[$(terminal) Install Promptfoo](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22npm%20install%20-g%20promptfoo%5Cu000D%22%7D)

Wait for installation to complete, then verify:

[$(terminal) Check Version](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22promptfoo%20--version%5Cu000D%22%7D)

steps.title: Create Your First Evaluation Config
steps.description:
Let's create a simple evaluation to compare how different models respond to a customer service scenario.

[$(file) Create Config File](command:promptfoo.createBasicConfig)

[$(eye) View Config](command:vscode.open?%5B%22promptfooconfig.yaml%22%5D)

steps.title: Run Your First Evaluation
steps.description:
Time to see Promptfoo in action! We'll evaluate GPT-4 and Gemini on language learning tasks.

[$(terminal) Run Evaluation](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22promptfoo%20eval%5Cu000D%22%7D)

**What to look for:**
- ‚úÖ Grading accuracy
- üìù Feedback quality
- ‚è±Ô∏è Response times
- üìä Side-by-side comparison

steps.title: Add Quality Checks
steps.description:
Let's add assertions to automatically check response quality.

[$(file) Open Config](command:vscode.open?%5B%22promptfooconfig.yaml%22%5D)

Add these assertions to ensure:
- Grades are within 1-10 range
- Feedback is constructive
- Mistakes are properly identified
- Response is encouraging

[$(terminal) Run with Assertions](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22promptfoo%20eval%5Cu000D%22%7D)

steps.title: View Results in Browser
steps.description:
Promptfoo can generate beautiful HTML reports for sharing results.

[$(terminal) View Results](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22promptfoo%20view%5Cu000D%22%7D)

This opens an interactive dashboard where you can:
- üìä Compare outputs side-by-side
- üîç Filter by test status
- üì§ Export results

steps.title: Test Multiple Scenarios
steps.description:
Real-world testing requires multiple test cases. Let's expand our evaluation.

[$(file-add) Add Test Scenarios](command:promptfoo.addTestScenarios)

We'll test:
- Perfect answers
- Common mistakes
- Grammar errors
- Vocabulary usage
- Edge cases

[$(terminal) Run Full Test Suite](command:workbench.action.terminal.sendSequence?%7B%22text%22%3A%22promptfoo%20eval%5Cu000D%22%7D)

steps.title: Optimize for Cost vs Quality
steps.description:
Let's compare different models for language learning tasks.

We'll test:
- GPT-4o-mini (grading accuracy)
- Gemini Pro (feedback quality)
- GPT-3.5 (cost-effective option)

[$(graph) View Cost Analysis](command:promptfoo.showCostAnalysis)

steps.title: Integrate with CI/CD
steps.description:
Make LLM testing part of your development workflow!

[$(file) Create GitHub Action](command:promptfoo.createGitHubAction)

This will:
- Run tests on every PR
- Prevent prompt regressions
- Track model performance over time
